name: Yanka Kupala
description: Yanka Kupala (real name Ivan Dominicovich Lutsevich) - Belarusian Soviet poet and translator, playwright, publicist. Classic of Belarusian literature.

biography.description: Born in the village of Vyazynka (Belarus) in a Belarusian Catholic family
He graduated from the public school in the town of Belaruch.
After the death of his father, he worked as a home teacher, a clerk in a landowner estate, a clerk and other work.
He lived in Vilnius, where he worked at the editorial office of the first Belarusian newspaper «Nasha Niva»
Studied in St. Petersburg at preparatory general education courses of A. Chernyaev.
He returned to Vilnius, where he first worked as a secretary of the Belarusian Publishing Partnership, and then again worked in «Nasha Niva»
He became the editor of the newspaper «Our Niva»
Drafted into the army. He entered the road construction detachment, as part of which he worked until the onset of the events of the October Revolution.
Moves to Minsk. Works in the People's Commissariat of Education of the BSSR.
On May 15, in connection with the 20th anniversary of creative activity, the government of the BSSR confers Y. Kupale the title of national poet of the BSSR.
The Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR for outstanding services in the development of Soviet literature awards Y. Kupal with the Order of Lenin.
Tragically died in the Moscow Hotel under unclear circumstances (fell into a flight of stairs from the 10th floor). He was buried at the Moscow Vagankovsky cemetery
